snippet: Officer Adrian Schoolcraft made hundreds of tapes of police superiors in Brooklyn, who, he said, were manipulating crime reports.
abstract: New York City lawyers have subpoenaed documents and tape recordings used by journalist Graham A Rayman in writing book The NYPD Tapes; focus of book is New York City Police Officer Adrian Schoolcraft, who has sued the city claiming his civil rights were violated in 2009 by Police Dept after he disclosed the manipulation of crime reports at his Brooklyn precinct; Graham says will not comply with subpoena.
lead_paragraph: Officer Adrian Schoolcraft made hundreds of tapes of police superiors in Brooklyn, who, he said, were manipulating crime reports.

headline.main: New York City Subpoenas Secret Tapes by Police Officer
headline.print_headline: New York City Subpoenas Secret Tapes By Officer
